result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court to address competency evaluation prepared by Dr. Collins. - Findings are defendant is not competent and not likely to regain within the statutory time frame.

Both State and Defense has received and reviewed copies of Dr. Collins report.
State is not objecting to Dr. Collins' findings.
State requests the matter be suspended and release the defendant from custody.
Defense does not object to Dr. Collins' findings.
Court finds the defendant is not currently competent and not likely to gain competence within the statutory time frame.
Court will suspend the proceedings and release the defendant from all bond conditions.
Any cash bail to be refunded to the poster.
State states victim would still like the restraining order to remain in place.
Review hearing on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

dated 01-12-2022 from WFU requesting an extension for the return of the written report to the Court beyond the next court date;  
  **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on 01-13-2022:  extension approved**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Ricardo Tapia

addressed to:  Mariah M Shipley for hearing on 01/24/2022
Return to Sender,  Unable to Forward.
Review hearing on January 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mariah M Shipley
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-05-2022)
Prior: 407 Morrissey Dr, North Prairie, WI 53153
Proposed Competency Order

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is to have no unsupervised use of a computer or a device that can send emails.  The Court will allow for the use of a smart phone but the defendant is not to use it to send emails.

01:08 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen for Attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency to tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Review hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on January 4, 2022.
Initial appearance on January 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

05:05 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez appears as friend of the court.  The Court received notice that the defendant has refused to come to Court today.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.  If the defendant refuses to come to Court tomorrow, the Court will authorize the use of force.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
